metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Use the else if statement to specify a new condition if the first condition is false .
content.html: Use the else if statement to specify a new condition if the first condition is false.

syntaxHighlighting.text:
if  condition1 { 
           // code to be executed if condition1 is true
// code to be executed if condition1 is true
// code to be executed if condition1 is false and condition2 is true

// code to be executed if condition1 and condition2 
        are both false

syntax_highlighting.text:
if condition1 { 
           // code to be executed if condition1 is true
// code to be executed if condition1 is true
// code to be executed if condition1 is false and condition2 is true

// code to be executed if condition1 and condition2 
        are both false

content.code_html:
if condition1 {
   // code to be executed if condition1 is true
} else if condition2 {
   // code to be executed if condition1 is false and condition2 is true
} else {
   // code to be executed if condition1 and condition2 are both false
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
if  condition1 { 
           // code to be executed if condition1 is true
// code to be executed if condition1 is true
// code to be executed if condition1 is false and condition2 is true

// code to be executed if condition1 and condition2 
        are both false

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  time := 22
  if time < 10 {
    fmt.Println("Good morning.")
  } else if time < 20 {
    fmt.Println("Good day.")
  } else {
    fmt.Println("Good evening.")
  }
}

content.text: In the example above, time (22) is greater than 10, so the first condition is false . The next condition, in the else if statement, is also false , so we move on to else condition since condition1 and condition2 are both false - and print to the screen "Good evening".
content.html: In the example above, time (22) is greater than 10, so the first condition is false. The next condition, in the else if statement, is also false, so we move on to else condition since condition1 and condition2 are both false - and print to the screen "Good evening".

content.text: However, if the time was 14, our program would print "Good day."
content.html: However, if the time was 14, our program would print "Good day."

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  a := 14
  b := 14
  if a < b {
    fmt.Println("a is less than b.")
  } else if a > b {
    fmt.Println("a is more than b.")
  } else {
    fmt.Println("a and b are equal.")
  }
}

syntaxHighlighting.text: "x is larger than or equal to 10."

syntax_highlighting.text: "x is larger than or equal to 10."

content.code_html:
package main
import ("fmt")

func main() {
  x := 30
  if x >= 10 {
    fmt.Println("x is larger than or equal to 10.")
  } else if x > 20 {
    fmt.Println("x is larger than 20.")
  } else {
    fmt.Println("x is less than 10.")
  }
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: "x is larger than or equal to 10."
